abstract: Ben Brantley reviews Signature Theater production of Suzan-Lori Parks play The Death of the Last Black Man in the Whole Entire World AKA The Negro Book of the Dead, directed by Lileana Blain-Cruz at Pershing Square Signature Center; Daniel J Watts and Roslyn Ruff star.

headline.print_headline: A Historical Nightmare of Racism, Hypnotically Retold
headline.main: Review: ‘The Death of the Last Black Man,’ a Nightmare Hypnotically Retold

keywords.value: The Death of the Last Black Man in the Whole Entire World AKA the Negro Book of the Dead (Play)
keywords.name: creative_works

snippet: Suzan-Lori Parks’s phantasmagorical theater piece is a sepulchral parade of images that have distorted and swallowed up the history of African-Americans....
lead_paragraph: Suzan-Lori Parks’s phantasmagorical theater piece is a sepulchral parade of images that have distorted and swallowed up the history of African-Americans.
